subject: Re: [junit] Mobile JUnit
msgSnippet: Once you run the exe, which is a self-installer, you get, among other things, a text file stating:
messageBody:
Once you run the exe, which is a self-installer, you get, among other
things, a text file stating:


*************************************************************************
*************************************************************************


This Software includes unmodified JUnit binary code developed under the
Common Public License Version 1.0 (CPL). The terms of the CPL are
available at
http://www.opensource.org/licenses/cpl.php . With respect to such binary
code,
source code can be obtained by e-mailing devsupport@....


*************************************************************************
*************************************************************************

I don't have enough brainpower right now to make a legal judgement, just
adding information.

David Saff

jimmack_oss wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> I was wondering if anyone could confirm my suspicion that Sony
> Ericsson are behaving badly. They have produced something they call
> "Mobile JUnit" and they have made it available for download here:
> http://developer.sonyericsson.com/site/global/docstools/java/p_java.jsp
>
> The problem is, the file is a Windows .exe contained in a .zip.
> That's no good to me on Linux. Aren't they contravening the open
> source license of JUnit by producing their own extension and not
> making the source code available?
>
> Your comments would be greatly appreciated :-)
>
> Kind regards.
>
> Jim.
>
>
>
>
